pair.Prompt: In October Term 1903, the Supreme Court of the United States (SCOTUS) heard the case of Northern Securities Co. v. United States.
pair.Response: Response: In this case, SCOTUS held that the power of Congress to regulate commerce did not extend to the ownership of stock in state corporations, because the products of such manufacture might subsequently become the subject of interstate commerce. The court also reaffirmed the definition of Chief Justice Marshall of commerce, in the constitutional sense.
